definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: He was cited for settling lawsuits correctly.
sentences.chinese: 他因斷案准確而受到表彰。

sentences.english: Compurgation was used frequently in manorial courts.
sentences.chinese: 宣誓斷案通常用於采邑法庭。

sentences.english: It was a major victory for the embattled software maker.
sentences.chinese: 這對陷入壟斷案的微軟公司來說是一個重大勝利。

sentences.english: The judge held the question in abeyance until he had the information necessary to make a decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在得到可供斷案的資料前，先擱置此案。

sentences.english: But he still has excellent judgement in solving criminal cases.
sentences.chinese: 但他對斷案仍有優秀的判斷力。

sentences.english: During the proceedings, the judge's trial skill was necessary to settle a lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 在訴訟中，司法官的審判技巧也是正確斷案所必需的。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
Jian Zoupianfeng, pseudonym of prolific modern novelist
the sword moves with side stroke (modern idiom)/fig. unexpected winning move/unconventional gambit
a tax declaration form/a tax return
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
